column4: tacoma, the monitor is a relatively new Dell LCD, but the system in question is one of two PC's connected to a Belkin 2-way KVM, which I think may be causing the problem.
dasEi, I didn't think they were dependent either but my boss thinks they are for some reason.  I think it might just be a coincidence that the box isn't pulling an IP
again, the xserver is not dependant from networking
any idea if or how the KVM connection could be causing the problem?  I think a direct connection to the monitor has solved the problem in the past.  Does X have error logs I could check for hints?
kvm might be, check /var/log/syslog and /var/log/Xorg.0.log for errors (KVM on), or do a customized xorg.conf, that overrides the (false) detection of kvm
okay.  I'll check that out.  Thanks
